album.title: It Takes a Nation of Millions to Hold Us Back

track.name: Party for Your Right to Fight
comments: not their strongest track but the album title drop in the lyrics and the flavor/chuck combo is really awesome.
I'm feelin this track XD
Kind of a lame way to end an amazing album.  [2]

This should never be compared to the Beastie track... these two groups are highly respected in the music industry and the songs tell two different stories... on totally different vibes as was intended.  Chuck D will be the first to admit that Beastie Boys was one of the main reasons P.E. became as great as they did.  Much love to PE and Beastie Boys!
This would not exist if it wasnt for the Beastie Boys. Ones fun, the others political. I know what one I wanna party to.
ain't nothin' but a party, yall
muito bom
YEAH YA'LL
Kind of a lame way to end an amazing album.
Well, who says my opinion is necessarily more right than other people? I hate it when I just can't get with the consensus on something.
This beats the Beastie Boys song anyday man.
Much worse than Fight for Your Right to Party. That one at least rocked. This one's pretty weak. Also, the drum machine is atrociously limp...
much better than fight for your right to party [3]
cool samples in this song
Having Chuck and Flav at the same time makes the song really intense. Fuckin awesome track.
